bug.short_desc: Visual Documentation of generate.py Job Process

long_desc.thetext:
Just a thought on generator documentation: I've always thought that a graphic view of how the source and build jobs operate would be most helpful, demonstrating the "combining" of configuration files into the final job result.
I'm sure that someone with an intimate knowledge of the build system could chunk out something representative on a napkin during a short break (or maybe not - we all need breaks).
Anyway, some type of tree or flow diagram that shows how a source job starts, processes, and finishes would go a long way to explaining how it all fits together. I would love to have a better understanding of the process, and this would explain more than multiple screens of text ever could. If a picture is worth a thousand words (still true?), it applies here as much as anywhere.
